utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: One. Don't tense up now. Go with him.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Two. That's it. Stay in rhythm.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Three. What are you doing, Lane? You're tipping in.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Four. What's your problem? Get your ass down. Get back in the middle.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Five. You're weak. You got all kinds of daylight under you.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Six. Damn, Lane, you should be schooling this bull.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Seven. Get up, set your hips before the kick comes down.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Nice recovery. Now just wait till he turns back away from your hand.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Whoo! Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Cowboy
utterance.content: Lane. Lane.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: What the hell just happened?

utterance.speaker: Cowboy
utterance.content: I was about to ask you the same thing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I assume Cuddy told you that she dumped me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She did.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And that I'm back on Vicodin.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She told me you had taken a Vicodin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And then I took a lot more. And so on.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: But you're fine?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I'm not fine as in "fine," but I'm fine as in "you don't have to worry about me."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Because you cleared out your bank account, checked into a hotel, and started back on Vicodin?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because I'm going to be fine as in "fine" very soon.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Until that happens, are you sure Vicodin is the…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My leg hurts.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You've been able to handle the pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's gotten worse.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not physically worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Worse is worse. Pain doesn't discriminate. Neither do the pills. The Vicodin and the five-star pampering that I'm gonna get over the next few days should be enough to get me through it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So you don't want to just avoid the issue. You want to avoid avoiding the issue. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing is either as bad or as good as we think it is at the time. That's why T.O. mocks his opponents immediately after scoring. He doesn't wait till his friend shows up the next day to tell him to deal with it. Two weeks from now, maybe a little more, maybe a little less, my life will be back to its usual level of crappiness. Till then, the only real issue is how much I'm gonna spend on hotel charges.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Good morning, sir. I've got your deluxe breakfast for two.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do I have to count the strawberries?

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Don't worry. You can trust me with anything. Including your food.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: After he and I have sex, I'm gonna slit his throat and then disembowel him in the bathtub.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Oh, no problem. I'll cancel the morning maid service. Would you like me to have them clean up later when they come to turn down your bed?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why didn't I meet you six months ago?

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Thank you very much. And if there's anything else I can do to make your stay here more enjoyable, just ring the concierge and ask for Carnell.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Eat fast. We're expecting company.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay. This might not be such a bad idea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What do you think he meant by "anything"?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Take some time for yourself. Relax.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know it's a figure of speech, to underline the "anything."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Maybe talk to someone?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Already scheduled.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not an idiot. I know I need help.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay. That's… great. I meant, like, a counselor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: But you meant a hooker.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. Baby steps.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: House screwed us.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ten years of doctors cobbling him back together. Metal rods in every limb. Pins stabilizing his spine. Five screws and a titanium plate in his skull.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Can't do MRIs. X-rays are probably gonna be useless as well. Every piece of metal is gonna obscure something.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And House isn't sick.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Why would you say that?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Cuddy dumped House. He's out somewhere expecting us to indulge him while he ignores his job and licks his wounds.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Cuddy dumped him?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Don't do that. Don't get sucked in.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He loves her. What? You can't feel bad for him for five minutes?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I can feel bad for him while still expecting him to act like an adult, show up for work, and not go on a booze-, Vicodin-, and hooker-filled bender.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Which is why for now we're gonna handle the case without him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oh, is that the reason? I thought it was because you can't pass up any chance to seize control.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I said "we." You want "pretty please" too?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Wait. I understand the booze and the hookers, but why Vicodin?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Wow, you really don't have any friends in here, do you?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House is a Vicodin addict. He's been clean for two years.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He's used here at work?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yes, that is very troubling. Almost as much as the fact that our patient

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What if the hearing loss wasn't caused by the bull? That's just when he noticed it? Inner-ear pathology can affect the equilibrium and cause disorientation, making it appear to be a neurological disorder.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So how do we confirm? CT is just gonna show us the plate and screws holding his skull together.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We can do calorics and an ENG. If he has inner-ear damage, it'll affect his balance.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sounds good. Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Go ahead? Really? What if one of us disagrees? I happen to agree with Foreman. Go do it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You knew he was an addict before you got involved.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Didn't end the relationship…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You knew he was an ass…

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I didn't end it…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You told him you did not want him to change.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And I was wrong.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You don't know that. You thought you were gonna die. Do you really think that was the right time to make this kind of decision?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. But I've thought about it. A lot. And I haven't changed my mind.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He thought you were gonna die. Nobody knows the right way to react in that situation. Just give him another chance. He deserves it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know. But this isn't about what he deserves. When things go wrong, I don't want to hope that I'm not alone. I want to know it. With House… every time I needed him to step up… He's just never gonna be that. It's not his fault. It's who he is. I should have known it. This is my fault.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, he's back on Vicodin. So you might want to… keep an eye on his new patient.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: ENG was normal. Means his inner ear isn't…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Morons.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It wasn't…

utterance.speaker: Hooker 1
utterance.content: Morons.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Who was that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Something Carnell got me.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It wasn't that ridiculous of a theory.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great theory. It's a ridiculous test. You can't give a standard balance test to a champion bull rider. If you're gonna test Superman's strength, you need a bigger barbell. Find one, make him lift it, then call me and tell me how high it got. And tell Cuddy that spying is for cowards.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Just keep me posted.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: You said my inner ear was fine.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Previous test was for regular people. You were banged up pretty bad in the accident. But given your athletic ability…

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Wasn't no accident. That bull had malice and forethought.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Uh, you mean aforethought.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Whatever. He was pissed.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Can you blame him?

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Not at all. If he don't do what he gets paid for, I don't get to do what I get paid for.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You ever think of getting paid for doing something else? You're running out of bones to break.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: You ever think of doing something you don't love? It has its downside, but everything does. There ain't nothing like those eight seconds. Traveling around, getting to meet the fans, that ain't so bad either, if you know what I mean. All right, now what?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We're gonna start rocking the platform and changing your visual field while you balance on just your right leg.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Here you go, Lane. I'm gonna start slow.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you start to experience any nausea or disorientation, just let us know and we'll stop the test.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Ha. That is amazing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We can stop. There's obviously nothing wrong with his inner ear. Now what? And I direct that question not to my boss, but to anyone who has an answer.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If it's not in his ear, it's got to be his brain.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: But if we can't get any images, then how do we…

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Looks like you guys got some rusty pipes. This water's brown.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's not from the pipes. It's from your mouth.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can you pass me the, um…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What took you so long?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There’s nothing wrong with his ears, but he's got blood in his sputum.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Doesn't answer the question.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We weren't avoiding you. It took us a little time to think up a diagnostic test no one's ever thought up before.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Apology accepted.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It could be a tumor in a salivary gland. We should get a parotid biopsy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, that's so cute. You're fighting over who's in charge.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: GI bleed's more likely to explain the nausea and weakness.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who's in charge?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House, as long as you're not here, someone has to have the final…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let me rephrase. Who's your daddy?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Let me rephrase. You have to decide if you're gonna buck up, get out of bed, and do your job, or if you're gonna wallow in self-pity.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Those my only two choices? Or can I also point out the self-pity coming from you? You're just annoyed because when your relationship ended, no one gave a crap, including you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That is not true in so many ways.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And, Chase, stop screwing with Foreman. And, Foreman, no. Till the telephone gets uninvented, no one in that room needs more authority than I give them, and right now I give you the authority to scope his GI tract and biopsy his parotid. And you can pick up the phone.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Wait, House, should we be more worried about you? Are you on Vicodin? Because if you are, you probably shouldn't be ordering procedures.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I am not on Vicodin. Do the tests. I have to see a man about a hurdy-gurdy.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You really think House isn't using Vicodin?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Does it actually worry you?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: If he's self-prescribing meds, that could affect his judgment.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And does that worry you?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Are you being sarcastic?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If his rule-breaking is affecting his judgment, then you can step in and you can worry, but if he's just coming up with ideas that we haven't thought of but we should have, then our job is to shut up and do it. And what do you see in this guy?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Hmm? What? Who? Oh. You think I'm attracted to our patient?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Right. It's against the rules, so you wouldn't do it.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He's a macho half-wit.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You have every reason to not be attracted to him, which is why I ask the question. Why are you attracted to him?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Stop it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm just…

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: No, no, no. Take out the scope.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But I don't see…

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Not the monitor. Look at his eyes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sclerae turned yellow. Did X-rays. Looks like there's a mass in his liver,

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Making it, as they say, as tough to find as a hooker who can play the hurdy-gurdy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you have a point, can you please…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's an expression. Means it's tough, but apparently it can be done.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If we don't have any equipment…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have eyes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Not that see through stuff.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Obviously.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You want us to cut him open?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Only if you want to see what's wrong with him. Do you know Free Bird?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Do you see what I see?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: More suction. That's impossible. I definitely saw a mass on the X-rays.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's gone now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a mass… And then it's not.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You, uh, gonna introduce us?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Team, meet Duke.

utterance.speaker: Anke
utterance.content: Anke.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anke? How'd I get Duke?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: House, how many prostitutes have you had?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: As in eaten? Ever? This year?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Slept with. Since you've been here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All but one. She did my taxes. On the other hand, tapeworm that burrowed

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We would have seen eggs on a fecal smear or systemic eosinophilia.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Detached cyst?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Couldn't migrate that far in one hour. We haven't been sitting on our hands just waiting for your brilliance to kick in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, so how did you shoot down intermittently swollen lymph node?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: That would mean it's some kind of an infection, which would mean we'd have to do a spinal tap. But with his recent skull fractures, it could be an increased ICP. His brain could herniate.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What about a ventricular puncture?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sounds good.

utterance.speaker: Master
utterance.content: You think sticking a needle directly into his brain would be less dangerous than sticking it in his spine?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's probably a push. I'm just trying to get you out of here, because underneath this sheet, stuff is going on.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just pick a spot and stick a needle in it.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: You want to drill through my skull because of a mass that's not there?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It was there, which means something is wrong. We need to find it.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Is there anybody you'd like us to call? Someone that you'd like to be here with you? Maybe a wife or girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: No, my family's all back in Oklahoma, and the guys on the circuit are in Calgary at the next rodeo.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Ah, that's too bad. It's nice to have somebody nearby you can talk to who cares.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I’m just saying, "it's good to have somebody near by to talk to who cares."

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Okay, fine. I like him. So what?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No kidding. I just can't figure out why.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Neither can I. Looks clear. Nothing is suggesting inflammation. Something's wrong.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: O-2 stats are plummeting. We need to intubate. Drop the table. I can't get it in.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: The airway's blocked. Get the trach kit.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: O-2 are going back up.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: What's that smell?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Did he defecate?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Doesn't look like it.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I think it's his feet. Oh. Oh, man. Ugh. It's definitely his feet.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Please don't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That is a nice bow.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: That was a nice door.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Put it on my tab. Let's say we take it up a notch.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Yeah, right. Very funny.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't trust me?

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Hooker 5
utterance.content: I'll do it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And we have a gamer.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Oh, come on, man. You can't be serious.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why not? Anything goes wrong, we just take her to the doctor. And I'm only eight paces away.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: House…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I like you, Carnell. Don't ruin it. Stinky feet can point to diabetes, athlete's foot, or gangrene… Pick one.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Uh, none. None of those cause bloody sputum or disappearing masses.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: No. No. No. No. You're gonna kill her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't do that, Carnell. They might get the idea that I'm shooting at a hooker. Fungal infection can cause ulceration between the toes and bleeding could be from recurring abscesses that appear to be recurring masses.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Symptoms in the head or feet mean the infection would have to be in the heart or the brain.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I say we start by looking in the heart, because looking at his brain with a metal plate is problematic.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So's MRI'ing his heart. He's got a seven-centimeter conductive metal rod holding his rib together. It'll rip him in two.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, it'll just feel like it's ripping him in two, which is much better.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We could minimize the damage by injecting ice water into his abdominal cavity.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: No. Please, no.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Oh, God!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oops. Got to go.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Call an ambulance!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: What do you mean why? She's hurt!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She doesn't look hurt.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: No, you didn't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, we did.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: You're an ass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. Go get me, uh, general Patton's colt 45. The one with the two notches.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He's not getting you a gun.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Your friend knows how to have a good time.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The MRI magnets are gonna heat the metal. Could get to over 300 degrees in 15 seconds.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Which is why we're injecting ice water into your abdominal cavity. You'll feel colder than you've ever felt, and then you'll be hotter… um, you'll feel hotter than you've ever felt. We'll try to be as quick as possible.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's interesting.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: No, it's not. It's mundane and simple. He's obviously a very blessed specimen, so from an evolutionary point of view, he'd produce healthy offspring, so my prefrontal cortex is telling me I should have sex with him.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Oh. Is that all?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Yes. My rational brain knows he's a hillbilly and an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And yet somehow your rational brain is losing the argument, which is interesting.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You were bored. You must have spent about two days setting up a fake murder, and you were bored.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're not. And I'm worried you might do something even stupider. Why don't you move back in with me? At least until you get back on track.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What an ego. You think you're some sort of emotional paragon? You're my rock?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm trying to be a friend.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: At least I have the good sense not to marry every woman I fall into bed with. Maybe you should move in with me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Either way. If you prefer…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I prefer you to stop talking about this.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, we haven't even started talking about this except to establish the fact that you are fine, which clearly you aren't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Leave me alone!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No. We are gonna talk about this, and we're gonna deal with this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So I have no choice? Fine. Unless… unless… Yes, I do. I do have legs. I see you didn't factor those into your brilliant plan.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Lane, can you try to hold still?

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: I'm trying. Real hard.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Guy is tough. I'll give him that. My prefrontal cortex is a little aroused.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Just get the damn picture. Rib temp is at 158.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don't have a clear view of his aorta yet.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: This isn't gonna work. We have to stop.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. You're trying to protect him instead of trying to save him.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He's smoking. Literally, you ass.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Five more seconds.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: No, getting a good image isn't gonna mean anything if he doesn't have a rib cage.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Whew.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The images… they're normal.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Whew. Ah. Whew.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're gonna have to talk to him eventually. He needs you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I love him. And I know he loves me. But I just can't…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He needs you in his life. Even if you're not sleeping with him, he needs you. Without you…

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You can't go backwards. I can't fix his problem. I am his problem.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If the infection's not in his heart, then it's in his brain. You're in my sun. Do a CT.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We can't. He has a titanium plate and a bunch of metal screws.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So get rid of them.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His skull has multiple hairline fractures. Removing the metal plate will be like removing half an eggshell without cracking the rest of the shell.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And not removing the plate will be like leaving the egg out to rot.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We can't cut off the top of his head based on a few symptoms that disappear whenever we try to test for them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What if the one symptom that hasn't disappeared was never actually there? Any delays when he answers questions? He doesn't have partial hearing loss. He's missing moments. He reported having something like a complex partial seizure during a bull ride. Said it hasn't happened since, but what if he's wrong? What if the infection in the brain is causing it to happen all the time?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His E.E.G. didn't show any sign of seizure activity.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't say it was a seizure. I said it was something like a seizure.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And I'm guessing you're about to tell us we need to find something like an E.E.G. to prove…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope, 'cause I already got one.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: You want me to sing? How's singing My Bonnie gonna help you see inside my brain?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It won't. It's just gonna prove that we need to cut into your skull, which is gonna be kind of dangerous. So you've got a real incentive to sing like an angel.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We think you're having mini blackouts, but your brain compensates.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It can't compensate if there's a preset rhythm. One, two, three.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: My Bonnie lies over the ocean my Bonnie lies… …over the sea My Bonnie… …lies over the ocean… …Oh, bring back my Bonnie to me See? Told ya.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Lane, that wasn't even close. That was brilliant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's understandable.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I hate when you do that. You respond to what you think I'm thinking, because you think that I think like you do. It's insulting and annoying.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're scared because nothing excites you. Fun doesn't excite you. Puzzles don't excite you. What's left? And I was saying you're right. You're upset. You're depressed. Everything's gonna taste a little worse right now, but it'll pass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's understandable. You're scared because you think I'm falling apart, and you're trying to convince yourself that you're overreacting.

utterance.speaker: Hooker 7
utterance.content: Keeps ringing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House, there's no infection in this guy's brain. CT's clean.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, that sucks. Now we have to blow up his heart.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We're not blowing up his heart, because we've ruled out his heart. MRI and transesophageal echo reveal no swelling, no masses, no vegetation, no sign of anything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Cause we're looking the wrong way. There's an imperfection. How do you find where?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't know. Get a magnifying glass and…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You suck. Feel free to interpret that both ways. Suck on the straw, see where the drink leaks.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're saying we put pressure on his aorta until it rips open? You do realize the downside of that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If we don't rip it, the damage from the infection will, probably not when he's got his chest open in an O.R. where it can be repaired inside the 60 seconds it'll take him to bleed to death.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's a ridiculous idea. It won't work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now if you don't mind… get this guy's approval to rip his heart open.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey. We think you have a Bartonella infection, which caused a mycotic aneurysm in your aortic wall. We need to find it, which means we need to blow up your heart. And, yes, I'm as serious as a heart attack. We're going to increase your blood pressure until the weak spot in your aortic wall explodes. Hopefully we'll be able to fix it before you bleed to death. Any questions?

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really? You don't even want to know if you'll be able to go back to bull riding?

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: I assume no? I mean, you've already cracked open my skull, and now you're gonna blow up my heart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thought you loved those eight seconds.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: I do. And now you're telling me that I got to give them up. I can always find something else to love.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House. We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You didn't expect me to say yes to rupturing his aorta, did you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Since I didn't ask, I wasn't expecting you to say anything at all.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You have no reason to believe this will save his life.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really? No reason? None at all? I'm just planning on cracking open his chest, blowing up his heart, what, to pad his bill? Or you think that since you broke my heart I want to break his.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't know. I think maybe you're looking for something that can excite you. Fill a void. And it's affecting your judgment.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right. I am. But my damaged, depressed, drug-addled judgment is still better than yours or any other doctor in this hospital, and my team is gonna do this procedure and save his life. So you can either have security arrest me and my team, or you can get the hell out of my way.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Annnnnd… she caves.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Rib spreader in place.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Heart looks good. The aorta's exposed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I take it you ratted me out to Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I think your judgment is compromised.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, you don't. Come on. I got a squash game at 2:00. Let's give this cowboy a ride.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If I inject more, there won't be any room for the blood to go through the rest of his body.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right. Let's make damn sure we don't damage his toes while we blow up his heart.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No bubbles, no bruising, no gaps. It's not working.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yes, it is.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I was wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Let's switch him over to bypass for the debridement. Come on. We don't have much time.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Slow the heart down—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Damn. Clamp.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We can't clamp the aorta at this pressure. Even if you can see through all the blood.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Do it anyway. We need suction and more sponges.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Leak is too fast.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, it's not. We can fix this.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It worked!?! House, it worked.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I heard you.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: I'm awake, so I guess it worked.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: As long as you don't get your heart rate too high. You, uh, probably shouldn't have sex for a while.

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: I'll keep that in mind.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Want to hang out, see your ranch sometime?

utterance.speaker: Lane
utterance.content: Uh…

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: That would probably be inappropriate, 'cause I'm your doctor and everything. Good luck with everything. It…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Double scotch. Doubled.

utterance.speaker: Bartender
utterance.content: Uh, blended? Single malt? Any preference?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Bartender
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry about the noise. I guess, uh, their team won. Although I got to tell you, sometimes I wish I could still act like that, you know? Just let loose. Ah, I guess it's a little easier, though, when you got no troubles. Parents still paying your bills. Got your whole life ahead of you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Noooooooooooooo!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cannonball!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What do you do when you win?

utterance.speaker: Students
utterance.content: Party!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What do you do when you lose?

utterance.speaker: Students
utterance.content: Party harder!
